Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as other reviews make it sound”
Reviews.Author: kerry38138
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the night before the Indy 500, front desk clerk was very friendly, place was clean, lobby and rooms, showers could have been better(low volume and pressure), my room didn't have a blow dryer...all may be that way, I would have stayed again there for 2012 Indy 500 but just checked and they rate they show on Wyndhamrewards.com is double what it was for this year....so I will be staying elsewhere..unless they drop the rate

Reviews.Title: “Honest front desk clerk said breakfast was not any good”
Reviews.Author: LodgerFromChicago
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Microtels before, and they are a fine bargain. The breakfasts are subpar. It was refreshing at check-in to hear the front desk clerk fess up that breakfast should be eaten elsewhere. This Microtel is near the Pyramids on the northside of Indianapolis, in a cluster of hotels. Thankfully, there is a Cracker Barrel nearby, so the breakfast dilemma is immediately resolved. Fine room, free long distance calls if you need to, color TV mounted high atop a closet. Somone's car alarm went off Sunday morning at 6 AM, so I got up 90 minutes earlier than planned.

Reviews.Title: “This place is horrible”
Reviews.Author: Belinda5
Reviews.Content: Absolutly disgusting. The only thing good about it was we didn't find any bugs. Continental breakfast was a joke plus the place was so dirty you were afraid to eat it.

Reviews.Title: “A very basic motel, good for a night”
Reviews.Author: adapaoferidu
Reviews.Content: A decent place if all you're looking for is a place to spend the night. Cleanliness could be better, but the bed was ok. I had no bites. The breakfast was lacking. There's a Starbucks, trader joes & a Five guys, 4 blocks away. I stayed in rm 110.

Reviews.Title: “The room was an ice box”
Reviews.Author: davef908
Reviews.Content: When we went to the room it was about 50 degrees. Turned the heater on, waited a little while no heat came out. Went to the desk and told them about the problem. They moved us to another room. The heat did not work in this room either. So ended up sleeping with several blankets covering us and our clothes and shoes on. After complaining to Microtel's main office they refunded half of our cost of the room.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL STAY EVER”
Reviews.Author: Laura99IN
Reviews.Content: We were traveling on our honeymoon and decided to pick somewhere cheap that we've stayed at before. On our arrival we waited for almost 5 minutes before someone came to the counter. We paid, went and retrieved our things, and went to the room. First thing we saw when we flipped on the light was a bug fly through the room. Then after sitting on the bed for 10 minutes the must and mold smell was so strong that I had a strong allergic reaction and couldn't breathe, almost an asthma attack. So we packed up our stuff and went to get a refund. The kid working there went and checked out the room and said it was "used" and he refused to give us our money back. Offered us another room. We argued with him for a good 30 minutes about giving us our money back while coughing my head off and thinking I'm on my way to the ER over it. Even called the cops but they said it was a civil matter and probably couldn't do anything. The guy was really rude, ripping paperwork out of our hands, to the point of where I thought there was going to be a physical fight. Then he said he wasn't going to give us another room. Eventually he showed us a few rooms, I took an allergy pill, and we found a new room that wasn't much better. The guests in the lobby were even saying that it wasn't right that he wouldn't give us our money back, that he was being very mean and rude to us. The room was dirty, moldy, carpet was so dirty we wore our shoes to go to the bathroom, just disgusting but they already had our money. We would've charged back but we used our bank card. The microtel we stayed at in Holland, Michigan was awesome. When we told all of our friends and family about it they were shocked as well because they have stayed in Microtels around the USA and loved them too. This one gives Microtel a VERY BAD name. I will never stay at a Microtel again and will never recommend one either. Horrible!!!!

Reviews.Title: “needs updating and cleaning”
Reviews.Author: alanphoenixaz
Reviews.Content: room needed good cleaning filthy carpets-good location several restraunts nearby-very nice and helpful front desk clerk

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - no major issues.”
Reviews.Author: New_friends_GR
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Microtel Inn back in July for a gathering of fellow roads enthusiasts. About five of us (who came from different locations) stayed at this hotel in three different rooms. At first when I booked the room and then saw some of the reviews on here, I was a little concerned. But honestly, it was okay for my 2-night stay. At first I'd booked a single room thinking I'd be in the room alone. But then upon talking to some of my fellow roads enthuasiasts, I found one person who wanted to split the cost and share his room with me. When I called to cancel my own reservation, the gentleman on the phone at first told me he couldn't cancel. But I gave him my confirmation number, and after a minute or so it was all set. (Weird.) He had what I believe was an Indian accent, so he may have been confused. The room was clean and comfortable. No problems there. The only annoyance I had was about the computer in the lobby for guests to use the Intenret on. The night check-in girl had whom I was believe was her boyfriend or husband (and also a young child or two) lingering around and spending too much time on the Internet. I can't remember whether there was a sign announcing a time limit for the computer, but at one point, I asked him if he'd be much longer. Finally he left and I was able to sign on to check my e-mail and stuff. The continental breakfast was fine - typically what you'd expect from a $70-a-night motel. Muffins, cereal, oatmeal, juice, etc. Overall, the hotel was okay. I probably wouldn't stay there again though - maybe only if it was cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “filthy floors”
Reviews.Author: Bonzer
Reviews.Content: In town for the traveling exhibit from the Louve, at the museum of art. Had a coupon from the travelers books you find at restaurants along the way, $39 per night plus taxes. Place looked clean from outside, inside lobby was OK. The room had filthy carpet needed to be swept and cleaned. The fan in the room had vents that were covered with dust and dirt. The bathroom floor was dirty and sticky (ugh). Fortunately the sheets were clean. Another concern there were fewer than 10 cars in the lot but they put everyone near each other. We heard some noise but fortunately the other guests quieted down to sleep early. I was happy with the bagels and muffins in the morning because they were individually wrapped. At check out they did not have modern office equipment, the clerk struggled to provide the receipt. We will return to the art museum it was fantastic! We will stay at a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Crooks and cheats”
Reviews.Author: dzb3kv
Reviews.Content: We were in Indianapolis for the Formula 1 race. We booked through Expedia with a rate of $59.95 which was "reconfirmed" a few days prior. When we tried to check out, we were told the rate was $130 per night and not $59.95. We were not alone, in the hour spent trying to check out, there were 4 other patrons with similar rate problems. When we tried to rectify, we were told the manager is not here and there is nothing the clerk can do. The clerk refused to call the manager and said we'd have to wait a couple of hours until he comes in. These people are crooks and cheats. Expedia will do nothing, so far the parent Microtel has done nothing. Classic bait and switch.

HotelInfo.Name: Motel 6 Pyramid's Indianapolis
HotelInfo.Address: 9140 North Michigan Road, Indianapolis, IN 46268
